intro: Maireana convexa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved maireana, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Maireana convexa is often found in sandy soils and is used in some traditional Aboriginal practices.
